alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Mayes; Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 7:02PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Delaware, southeastern Ottawa and northeastern Mayes Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 702 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Spavinaw, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Jay... Grove... Langley... Spavinaw... Disney... Hoot Owl... Honey Creek State Park... Spavinaw State Park... Chloeta... Dodge... Cayuga... Strang... Disney Little Blue State Park... Zena... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
